overview: This subject is an introduction to Akkadian grammar and the cuneiform writing system. It covers grammatical concepts and paradigms, sentence formation and translation and reading simple texts. Background information on the ancient Mesopotamian context in which Akkadian was spoken is woven into the subject matter. The aim is for students to acquire the elements of the grammar, syntax and vocabulary of Akkadian, knowledge of cuneiform script and attain reading skills sufficient to begin reading historical, literary and dramatic texts.
ilo: Read and comprehend basic Akkadian texts
Translate basic Akkadian passages and sentences into English
Identify and explain basic Akkadian grammar, vocabulary and syntax
Identify and articulate the relationship between basic Akkadian texts and their original socio-cultural context.
generic_skills: Have an understanding of social, ethical and cultural context of the Akkadian language
Be skilled in critical thinking and analysis
Possess effective written and communication skills
Have an understanding of social, ethical and cultural context.

assessment.brief: Five short assessment exercises (two in-class and three take-home). Each of these will be 400 words and focus on some specific aspect of grammar and syntax, from basic to more complex.

assessment.timing: 1 Weeks after the end of teaching
